A

ArrayHandler - Class in src.tictactoe.util
ArrayHandler class contains methods to inspect a 2D-array from every direction.
ArrayHandler() - Constructor for class src.tictactoe.util.ArrayHandler
 
askUserInput(int, int, String, String) - Static method in class src.tictactoe.Main
askUserInput asks user to give a number between two values.

C

checkColumns(String[][], String, int) - Method in class src.tictactoe.util.ArrayHandler
checkColumns method goes through each column to see if pc or player has won the game Goes through each column from top to bottom counting the given marks to check if there's enough of them in a row to make this return as true.
checkDiagonalLines(String[][], String, int) - Method in class src.tictactoe.util.ArrayHandler
checkDiagonalLines method goes through diagonal lines The method goes through each diagonal line starting from top left going to bottom right Then it goes through diagonal lines from bottom left to top right
checkForDraw(String[][], String) - Method in class src.tictactoe.util.ArrayHandler
checkForDraw Method goes through each square to see if there isn't any empty squares after player have taken their turns.
checkForWin(String[][], String, int, boolean) - Method in class src.tictactoe.util.ArrayHandler
checkForWin uses different methods to see if there's a winner in the game Uses different methods in this class that go through the given array in multiple ways.
checkRows(String[][], String, int) - Method in class src.tictactoe.util.ArrayHandler
checkRows method goes through each row to see if pc or player has won the game Goes through each row from left to right counting the given marks to check if there's enough of them in a row to make this return as true.
ComputerLogic - Class in src.tictactoe.util
ComputerLogic class contains all the code that's being used to prevent player from winning This class has several methods that are used by one single method that is called in the main class of this app I wanted to avoid having several different methods being called in the main.
ComputerLogic() - Constructor for class src.tictactoe.util.ComputerLogic
 

D

drawGameBoard(String[][]) - Static method in class src.tictactoe.Main
drawGameBoard method prints the current state of the gameboard.

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class src.tictactoe.Main
Main method of the program uses two utility classes to help navigate game The size of the gameboard and amount required to win are both decided by the user.
Main - Class in src.tictactoe
TicTacToe is a game where you compete against AI to see who first gets required amount of marks in a row correct This app asks the user how large of a game area they want This is the main class but there are few additional classes that are Math, Arrays and MyConsole.
Main() - Constructor for class src.tictactoe.Main
 
markColumn(String[][], String, String, String, int) - Static method in class src.tictactoe.util.ComputerLogic
markColumn method places computer mark if there's a chance for player to win.

markDiagonalBotLeft method places computer mark if there's a chance for player to win.
markDiagonalTopLeft(String[][], String, String, String, int) - Static method in class src.tictactoe.util.ComputerLogic
markDiagonalTopLeft method places computer mark if there's a chance for player to win.
markRow(String[][], String, String, String, int) - Static method in class src.tictactoe.util.ComputerLogic
markRow method places computer mark if there's a chance for player to win.

P

placeMark method places computer mark to a slot determined by multiple methods.

R

randomizeSlot(String[][], String, String, String) - Static method in class src.tictactoe.util.ComputerLogic

T

tryToWin(String[][], String, String, String, int) - Static method in class src.tictactoe.util.ComputerLogic
tryToWin method calculates if the computer is close to winning horizontally or vertically and then places it's mark if it can win.
